definition: lottery/lotto (loanword)
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue
to penetrate/to pass through/thoroughly/completely/transparent/to appear/to show
to have a win in the lottery

sentences.english: He fantasized about winning the lottery.
sentences.chinese: 他已經幻想自己贏到樂透。

sentences.english: After winning the lottery jackpot, he went from rags to riches overnight.
sentences.chinese: 贏了樂透頭彩後，他一夕之間從一貧如洗變成富翁。

sentences.english: As a result, many state lotteries have redesigned their tickets.
sentences.chinese: 結果，很多州的樂透重新設計了它們的彩票。

sentences.english: Lotto night comes and Babbette still has no luck.
sentences.chinese: 樂透開獎的夜晚來臨了，但芭芘特還是沒有運氣。

sentences.english: This item can be won in the custom item lottery.
sentences.chinese: 本物品可在物品樂透中獲得。

sentences.english: You pray at temples for a winning lottery number.
sentences.chinese: 在寺廟裏祈求樂透中獎號碼。

sentences.english: We save winning lotto picks in a text file.
sentences.chinese: 把贏獎的樂透選擇保存到文本文件中。

sentences.english: By American retailing standards, Tesco is merely dipping a toe in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 按照美國零售業標準，樂透才僅僅剛入行。

sentences.english: When it is when there is envy in the Lotto , who not surprising.
sentences.chinese: 當它時，是在樂透，誰也就不足爲奇羨慕。

sentences.english: Instead of secretly plundering the game, he decided to go to the Ontario Lottery and Gaming Corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有祕密地搶劫樂透，而是決定找安大略博彩公司。

sentences.english: Lotto Creo Pro helps you to play the lottery in an intelligent and simple way.
sentences.chinese: 樂透克里奧親幫助您發揮彩票在智能及簡單的途徑。

sentences.english: The beggar went from rags to riches overnight after winning the lottery.
sentences.chinese: 這個乞丐贏了樂透後，一夕之間從窮人變成富人。

sentences.english: Complaining about a lottery talent in the second round is lame.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟在第二輪選中樂透選手是很炫的事。

sentences.english: "I feel like I just won the lotto, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我感覺就像剛剛贏得了樂透大獎，”他如是說。

sentences.english: In addition, the three-point shot has created a kind of lotto fever.
sentences.chinese: 此外，三分球命中已經形成了一種樂透發燒。

definition: first prize in a lottery
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
requirement/necessary condition (math)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to be determined to win (idiom)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to have one's wish fulfilled
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
